full_text: BPD gate pea re a IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM 2018/KER(274 PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA THURSDAY, THE 4TH DAY OF JANUARY 2018 / 14TH POUSHA, 1939 Crl1.MC.No. 8857 of 2017 CRIME NO. 917/2016 OF HOSDURG POLICE STATION, KASARGOD PETITIONER(S) /ACCUSED : ABDUL MAJEED P., S/O. SAINABA, ALAMPADY HOUSE, KOLAVAYAL P.O. BY ADV.SRI.O.D.SIVADAS RESPONDENT (S) /COMPLAINANT AND STATE: 1. THE SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE, HOSDURG POLICE STATION, HOSDURG, KASARAGOD DISTRICT -673 001. 2. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM - 682 031. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.ALEX M.THOMBRA THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 04-01-2018, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Msd. BPD reece ieee Crl.MC.No. 8857 of 2017 2018/KERI274 APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' ANNEXURES : ANNEXURE AL COPY OF THE REPORT DATED 08.05.2017. ANNEXURE A2 COPY OF THE ORDER DATED 20.10.2017 IN CMP 3500/2017 OF JFCM-I, HOSDURG. RESPONDENT (S)' ANNEXURES : NIL //TRUE coPpy// P.S.TO JUDGE Msd. 2018/KER/274 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 4" day of January, 2018 ORDER It has been reported that even though the proceedings were initiated against the petitioner under Section 379 IPC and Section 20 of the Kerala Protection of River Banks and Regulation of Removal of Sand Act, 2001, on chemical analysis, the sand involved was proved to be ordinary sand and not river sand. Matters being so, the final report in Crime No.917/2016 of Hosdurg Police Station is not legally sustainable and the same is liable to be quashed. Therefore, Annexure-A2 order passed by the court below is also liable to be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and the final report in Crime No.917/2016 of Hosdurg Police Station and Annexure-A2 order are quashed. Sd/- (B.KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE) aks/04/01 // True Copy // PS to Judge
